Now

What is this?

It’s a now page: what I’m focused on at the moment, both professionally and personally. It’s what I’d tell on old co-worker if we met up for a 30 minute lunch. Inspired by Derek Sivers. Trying to keep it updated at least monthly.

Last updated May 9th, 2022.

Professional

Work Stuff

Still at Suffolk Law School’s Legal Innovation and Technology (LIT) Lab, working on court form software. My main focus right now is to get our efile-proxy (and corresponding docassemble library) ready for a 1.0 release. That means I need to review and redo CI for testing, documentation, and some final security audits.

It also means making sure that docassemble and our guided interviews built on top of it are accessible. I’ve been reading up and using on a lot of accessibility standards and tools, and am starting to write a blog post about that experience.

Latest Github Activity

  • Made a pull request in the SuffolkLITLab/docassemble-ALToolbox repo.

    Correct `aria-controls` to refernce correct id

    Issue was caught by aXe-core testing: https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.4/aria-valid-attr-value?application=axe-puppeteer

    The issue happened because `tag_group_name` was added to the beginning of each id / href, but not to aria-controls.

    The `tab_id` was never used individually, so I just updated it to include both `tab_group_name` and `tab_id`,

    and then replaced its used in the tabs and tab panels.

Long Term Career Stuff

My position at the LIT Lab is grant funded, and ends in Q3 2023, so I’ll be looking for a new gig around then! I have a variety of different tech skill sets, and am not concerned about developing a few more, and am more interested in making sure that I work at a place helps under-served communities help themselves.

Personal

Doing

Exploring Mastodon/Fediverse, trying to figure out a way to enjoy social media.

Gaming

Currently playing through Red Dead Redemption 2. Not my normal type of game, but I’m going through a list of all of the great games I’ve heard about on PS4.

Played minit recently. It was pretty short, has a neat gimmick, and was fun for the length (beat it in about 90 minutes with 58% completion).
